basic.floral_language:
Pachyveria 'Glauca'
Floriography: vigorous, beautiful, delicate
Has a tight compact rosette form with rigid fleshy leaves in long oval shapes with small tips, thick particularly along the middle part, surface covered by white powders, with great diurnal temperature range and abundant sunlight, leaf tips turn red. 
Likes sunny places, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, orange.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray blue, with adequate sunlight, leaf tips turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, no apparent period of dormancy, shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer high temperature
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
